messages.content: What is the batch number for Nitroso Aryl Piperazine Quetiapine?
The batch number is VOY756.
What is the product code for batch VOY756?
The product code for batch VOY756 is VE009S54.
Where was batch VOY756 manufactured?
Batch VOY756 was manufactured at SynTech Pharmaceuticals Inc.
What are the manufacturing dates for batch VOY756?
Manufacturing started on 2025-04-15 and ended on 2025-04-24, with an expiry date of 2027-04-15.
How many containers are in batch VOY756?
Batch VOY756 contains 820 Bts (bottles).
What is the batch size for batch VOY756?
The batch size is 600 L.
What is the disposition status of batch VOY756?
The disposition status is Quarantine. The batch is not released or rejected at this time.
Who is the QA Manager for batch VOY756?
The QA Manager is Priya Desai.
What is the yield for batch VOY756?
The yield is 97,850 tablets X 500 mg = 48.925 kg.
What is the percent yield for batch VOY756?
The percent yield is (48.925 kg ÷ 50 kg) X 100 = 97.85%.
Is the yield within the expected range for batch VOY756?
Yes, the yield of 97.85% is within the expected range of 95.0% - 102.0%.
What manufacturing stage is batch VOY756?
Batch VOY756 is in the Clinical (Phase I-III) manufacturing stage.
List all the lot numbers used in batch VOY756.

The lot numbers used are: LOT-APR-002, LOT-APR-003, LOT-APR-004, LOT-APR-005, AC0242C, AM3326, PC0911, ET5568, BB7821, PG-290058, SSL-4733, APC-18770, LOT-BF-2025, LOT-PVC-2025, LOT-CT-2025, LOT-SH-2025, and LOT-LB-2025.
What documents are available for batch VOY756?

Available documents include: BRS_VOY756.pdf (Batch Record Summary), ATR_VOY756.pdf (Analytical Testing Reports), CCI_VOY756.pdf (Change Control), CC_VOY756.pdf (Calibration Certificates), CLR.pdf (Cleaning Logs), COA_VOY756.pdf (Certificate of Analysis), CS_VOY756.pdf (CAPA Documentation), CVR_VOY756.pdf (Cleaning Verification Report), DR_VOY756.pdf (Deviation Reports), ECR_VOY756.pdf (Equipment Cleaning Records), EMR_VOY756.pdf (Environmental Monitoring Reports), IR_VOY756.pdf (Investigation Reports), MRS.pdf (Material Reconciliation Sheets), MRSL_VOY756.pdf (Material Receipt & Sampling Logs), PCTD_VOY756.pdf (Process Change Tracking Document), and PR_VOY756.pdf (Packaging Records).
What raw materials were used in batch VOY756?

The raw materials used include: Ceftazorin API (Lot AC0242C, 180 Lts), Sterile Water (Lot AM3326, 180 Lts), Benzyl Alcohol (Lot PC0911, 75 Lts), Polysorbate 80 (Lot ET5568, 100 Lts), and Sodium Citrate (Lot BB7821, 40 Lts).
What equipment was used for batch VOY756?
Equipment used includes: MIX-401 (Mixing Vessel), FILL-402 (Filling Machine), TANK-460 (Holding Tank), PUMP-210 (Transfer Pump), and FILTER-115 (Sterile Filter).
Were all equipment cleaned before batch VOY756?
Yes, all equipment (MIX-401, FILL-402, TANK-460) were cleaned on 2025-04-14 and passed inspection with cleaning verified as 'Yes'.
What in-process control tests were performed for batch VOY756?
In-process control tests included: pH (Target: 6.5-7.5, Actual: 7.1, PASS), Viscosity (Target: 150-200, Actual: 160, PASS), and Volume Fill (Target: 0.1490-0.500, Actual: 0.1501, PASS).
What were the environmental monitoring results for batch VOY756?
Environmental monitoring results: Air (Viable) - 98% (Limit: 95-100%, Pass), Surface - Clean (Pass), and Personnel - None detected (Pass).
What analytical tests were performed on batch VOY756?

Analytical tests performed include: Appearance (Clear, Pass), pH (7.1, Pass), Viscosity (160 cP, Pass), Volume Fill (0.1501 mL, Pass), Particulate Matter (2 particles/mL, Pass), Osmolality (295 mOsm/kg, Pass), Residual Solvents (ND, Pass), and Microbial Limits (<1 CFU/mL, Pass).
What was the purity result for batch VOY756?
The HPLC assay showed 99.1% purity, exceeding the minimum requirement of ≥ 98.0%. Status: Pass.
Was the identity confirmed for batch VOY756?
Yes, identity was confirmed via NMR and FTIR spectral match to reference standard. Status: Pass.
What instruments were used for analytical testing of batch VOY756?

Instruments used include: HPLC-3000 (Valid, calibrated 2025-04-10), NMR-400 (Valid, calibrated 2025-04-11), FTIR-200 (Valid, calibrated 2025-04-09), GC-250 (Valid, calibrated 2025-04-12), Viscometer VISC-100 (Valid), pH Meter PHM-55 (Valid), and Osmometer OSM-300 (Valid).
Who performed the analytical testing for batch VOY756?
The analyst was Dr. P. Uruig (tested on 2025-04-18), reviewer was Dr. S. Filipe (reviewed on 2025-04-19), and QA Manager was Rakuta Onumal (approved on 2025-04-20).
What deviations were reported for batch VOY756?

Deviations reported include: DEV-003 (Temp excursion during filtration, Minor impact), DEV-004 (Missing initials on volume fill log, Minor impact), DEV-005 (Pump-210 pressure spike, Moderate impact), DEV-006 (ISO 7 room particle count exceeded, Moderate impact), and DEV-007 (Incorrect label on raw material container, Major impact).
What CAPA actions were taken for batch VOY756?

CAPA actions taken include: CAPA-003 (HVAC recalibration with monthly checks, Closed), CAPA-004 (Log updated with SOP refresher training, Closed), CAPA-005 (Valve replaced with pre-use checklist, Closed), CAPA-006 (Area re-cleaned with gowning retraining, Closed), and CAPA-007 (Container relabeled with barcode verification SOP update, Closed).
What was the root cause for deviation DEV-003?
The root cause for DEV-003 was HVAC fluctuation. Corrective action: HVAC recalibrated. Preventive action: Monthly HVAC checks implemented.
What was the root cause for deviation DEV-005?
The root cause for DEV-005 was valve misalignment in Pump-210. Corrective action: Valve replaced. Preventive action: Pre-use valve check added to checklist.
What change control was implemented for batch VOY756?

Change control CAPA-VOY756-02 was implemented to revise the mixing sequence. Sodium Acetate is now introduced first, followed by gradual addition of Aryl Piperazine under controlled RPM to minimize foaming and improve homogeneity. SOP-MFG-104 was updated accordingly.
Why was the mixing process changed for batch VOY756?

The change was made due to observed excessive foaming during batch VOY756 leading to material loss of approximately 0.3 kg and extended processing time of 45 minutes. The improper mixing order was identified as the root cause.
Who approved the process change for batch VOY756?
The process change was approved by: Priya Desai (QA Manager, April 16, 2025), Kunal D'Souza (Production Head, April 16, 2025), and Hana Takeda (Regulatory Affairs, April 17, 2025).
What training was provided for the process change?

Training was provided to: Arjun Patel (Manufacturing Operator, April 14, 2025), Sneha Rao (QA Associate, April 14, 2025), and Ravi Narayan (Documentation Analyst, April 15, 2025). All were trained by Vishal Mehta using training material TM-MIXSEQ-2025.
What calibration was performed for batch VOY756?

Certificate CAL-2025-0417 was issued on April 17, 2025 for routine annual calibration of Digital Temperature Probe (EQ-TEMP-0093). Test points at 20.0°C, 25.0°C, and 30.0°C all passed within ±0.1°C tolerance.
What equipment was calibrated for batch VOY756?

Digital Temperature Probe (Model TPX-3000, Serial SN-TPX-0093-APR) from ThermoTrak Instruments was calibrated for use in ISO 7 Fill Room – Line 4. Calibration performed by Ravi Menon (Metrology Engineer) and reviewed by Priya Desai (QA Reviewer).
What cleaning was performed for batch VOY756?

Cleaning performed on August 18, 2025 included: Dispensing Room (07:15 AM by R. Martinez), Weighing Balance (07:20 AM), Stainless Steel Scoops (07:25 AM), Transfer Containers (08:15 AM), Granulation Room (08:00 AM by S. Patel), Mixing Paddles (08:10 AM), and Corridor Zone A (08:30 AM by J. Lin). All verified by A. Kapoor.
What cleaning agents were used for batch VOY756?

Cleaning agents used include: NaOCl 0.5% (for mopping floors in rooms and corridors), IPA 70% (for wiping walls, doors, balances, and sanitizing tools), applied with appropriate PPE (gloves, masks, aprons).
What is the Certificate of Analysis number for batch VOY756?
The Certificate of Analysis document number is COA-SYN-4736 for batch VOY756.
When was the COA testing performed for batch VOY756?
COA testing was performed on 2025-04-18. The analyst was Dr. A. Yong, reviewed by Dr. S. Lin, with sample ID SAMP-002 taken on 2025-04-16.
What methods were used for analysis in the COA?

Methods used include: HPLC (HPLC-3000, SOP-HPLC-102, calibrated 2025-04-10), NMR (NMR-400, SOP-NMR-201, calibrated 2025-04-11), FTIR (FTIR-200, SOP-FTIR-305, calibrated 2025-04-09), and MS (MS-500, SOP-MS-410, calibrated 2025-04-12). All instruments were Valid.
What were the NMR results for batch VOY756?
NMR results showed: 3.65 m 2H CH₂-O Match and 7.15–7.45 m 5H Aromatic Match, confirming the identity of the product.
Who signed the Certificate of Analysis for batch VOY756?
The COA was signed by: Dr. A. Patel (Analyst, 2025-04-18), Dr. S. Lin (Reviewer, 2025-04-19), and Raj Patel (QA Manager, 2025-04-20).
What is the final disposition of the COA results?

Final disposition: All parameters passed. Purity (HPLC): 99.1% (≥98.0%, Pass), Identity (NMR): Confirmed (Match, Pass), Appearance: Clear (Pass), pH: 7.1 (6.5–7.5, Pass), Viscosity: 160 cP (150–200 cP, Pass).
What CAPA documentation exists for batch VOY756?
CAPA document CS_VOY756.pdf (Document No: CAPA-SYN-4737) contains 5 CAPAs: CAPA-003 through CAPA-007, all with status Closed. QA Reviewer: Priya Desai, CAPA Coordinator: Dr. Leandro Costa.
What was CAPA-003 for and who was responsible?

CAPA-003 addressed temperature excursion during filtration (DEV-003). Corrective action: HVAC recalibration. Preventive action: Monthly HVAC checks. Responsible person: Dr. Leandro Costa. Status: Closed.
What was CAPA-004 for and who was responsible?
CAPA-004 addressed missing initials on log (DEV-004). Corrective action: Log updated and verified. Preventive action: SOP refresher training. Responsible person: Ms. Hana Takeda. Status: Closed.
What was CAPA-005 for and who was responsible?
CAPA-005 addressed pump pressure spike (DEV-005). Corrective action: Valve replaced. Preventive action: Pre-use valve checklist. Responsible person: Mr. Yusuf El-Amin. Status: Closed.
What was CAPA-006 for and who was responsible?

CAPA-006 addressed particle count exceeded due to improper gowning technique (DEV-006). Corrective action: Area re-cleaned and retested. Preventive action: Gowning retraining. Responsible person: Dr. Emilia Novak. Status: Closed.
What was CAPA-007 for and who was responsible?

CAPA-007 addressed incorrect label on container (DEV-007). Corrective action: Container relabeled. Preventive action: Barcode verification SOP update. Responsible person: Mr. Jean-Pierre Moreau. Status: Closed.
What cleaning verification was performed for batch VOY756?

Cleaning verification (CVR-VOY756-01) was performed on April 14, 2025 using Swab Test + Visual Inspection + Conductivity Check. All equipment (MIX-401, FILL-402, TANK-460, PUMP-210, FILTER-115) passed verification. QA Reviewer: Priya Desai.
What were the cleaning verification results for equipment?
Verification results: MIX-401 (No residue, Pass), FILL-402 (Clean, Pass), TANK-460 (No residue, Pass), PUMP-210 (Clean, Pass), FILTER-115 (Sterile, Pass).
What deviation reports were filed for batch VOY756?

Deviation reports (DR_VOY756.pdf) for date range 2025-04-15 to 2025-04-24 include: DEV-003 (Process deviation, Minor), DEV-004 (Documentation deviation, Minor), DEV-005 (Equipment deviation, Moderate), DEV-006 (Environmental deviation, Moderate), and DEV-007 (Material Handling deviation, Major).
What was the impact level of deviation DEV-007?
DEV-007 had a Major impact level. It involved incorrect label on raw material container (warehouse labeling error) on 2025-04-20. CAPA-007 was initiated to address it.
When were the CAPA actions closed for batch VOY756?
CAPA closure dates: CAPA-003 closed 2025-04-22, CAPA-004 closed 2025-04-20, CAPA-005 closed 2025-04-21, CAPA-006 closed 2025-04-22, CAPA-007 closed 2025-04-23.
What is the final QA disposition for deviations in batch VOY756?
Final QA Disposition by Priya Desai (QA) on 2025-04-24: Approved. Remarks: All deviations resolved. CAPAs verified. Batch VOY756 approved for release.
What equipment cleaning records exist for batch VOY756?

Equipment Cleaning Records (ECR-SYN-4736 REVISION: 1.0, Lot LOT-APR-002) show cleaning performed on 2025-04-14 for: MIX-401, FILL-402, TANK-460, PUMP-210, and FILTER-115. All equipment last used 2025-04-13, cleaned and approved.
What were the equipment cleaning inspection results?

Inspection results: MIX-401 (No residue, <1 µS/cm conductivity, QA: AP), FILL-402 (Clean, <1 µS/cm, QA: AP), TANK-460 (No residue, <1 µS/cm, QA: AP), PUMP-210 (Clean, <1 µS/cm, QA: AP), FILTER-115 (Sterile, N/A, QA: AP). All Approved.
Who performed the equipment cleaning for batch VOY756?

Cleaning performed by: ML (MIX-401, verified by RD, QA review 2025-04-15), RD (FILL-402, verified by ST, QA review 2025-04-15), ST (TANK-460, PUMP-210, FILTER-115, verified by ML, QA review 2025-04-15). Final QA Signature: Harvey Rosenblum, 2025-04-15.
What environmental monitoring was performed for batch VOY756?

Environmental Monitoring Report (EMR-SYN-4737, Lot LOT-APR-003) for monitoring period April 15–April 24, 2025 tracked: Temperature, Humidity, Particle Count, Surface Cleanliness, and Personnel Hygiene. All parameters passed. QA: Priya Desai.
Was there a temperature excursion during batch VOY756?

Yes, on 2025-04-18 at 08:00 in the Fill Room, temperature reached 25.8°C (excursion) lasting 10 minutes. Cause: HVAC fluctuation. Impact: Minor. CAPA-003 was initiated for HVAC recalibration and monthly monitoring.
What was the root cause analysis for the temperature excursion?

Root cause analysis investigated: HVAC Logs (temporary sensor lag detected), Operator Activity (no deviation from SOP), Equipment Heat Load (normal), Historical Data (no prior excursions in this room).
What corrective action was taken for the temperature excursion?
CAPA-003: Corrective action - HVAC recalibration (completed 2025-04-19, verified by PD). Preventive action - Monthly HVAC monitoring added to SOP (completed 2025-04-20, verified by PD).
What investigation report exists for batch VOY756?

Investigation Report IR-VOY756-07 dated April 18, 2025 documents the foaming incident during compounding. Unexpected foam volume overflow resulted in 0.3 kg material loss and 45-minute delay. Initial Classification: Minor Deviation. Deviation ID: DR-VOY756-03. CAPA Reference: CAPA-VOY756-02.
What corrective actions were defined in the investigation report?

Corrective actions include: Update SOP-MFG-104 with visual mixing checklist (Priya Desai, April 20, 2025, Completed), Retrain all operators on revised SOP (Vishal Mehta, April 21, 2025, Completed), Implement version control audit for batch binders (Ravi Narayan, April 22, 2025, Completed), Add mixing order prompt to equipment HMI panel (Kunal D'Souza, April 25, 2025, In Progress).
What materials were reconciled for batch VOY756?

Material Reconciliation Sheet (MRS-VOY756-01, April 24, 2025) shows: RM-APQ-001 Aryl Piperazine HCl (25 kg received, 24.2 kg used, 0.5 kg returned, 0.3 kg lost, Reconciled, Released), RM-SOL-008 Sodium Acetate Anhydrous (15 kg received, 14.6 kg used, 0.2 kg returned, 0.2 kg lost, Reconciled, Released), RM-PHOS-003 Dibasic Sodium Phosphate (20 kg received, 19.1 kg used, 0.6 kg returned, 0.3 kg lost, Reconciled, Released).
Who authorized the material reconciliation for batch VOY756?
Authorized by: Kunal D'Souza (Production Lead, 2025-04-24), Priya Desai (QA Reviewer, 2025-04-24), and Hana Takeda (Inventory Manager, 2025-04-24).
What material receipt and sampling logs exist for batch VOY756?

Material Receipt & Sampling Log (MRSL-VOY756-01, April 14, 2025) shows: RM-APQ-001 (25 kg, Container CNT-04578, Released, sampled 2025-04-13, 250 g sample, Pass - Meets specs), RM-SOL-008 (15 kg, Container CNT-04579, Released, sampled 2025-04-13, 200 g sample, Pass - No visual defects), RM-PHOS-003 (20 kg, Container CNT-04580, Quarantined, sampled 2025-04-13, 300 g sample, Hold - Label under review).
Who performed the material sampling for batch VOY756?
All material sampling was performed by Kunal D'Souza on 2025-04-13. QA Review and Approval by Priya Desai on April 14, 2025. Status: RM-PHOS-003 under evaluation; other materials released.
What process change tracking was documented for batch VOY756?

Process Change Tracking Document (PCTD-2025-0818-PC01) for product Quetiapine Fumarate Extended Release Tablets, batch QF-ER-756, initiated August 10, 2025. Impact assessment shows: Blend Uniformity (Low risk), Potency Distribution (Medium risk), Batch Yield (Positive - 6% increase), Equipment Utilization (Positive - reduced downtime), Regulatory Filing (Low risk).
What validations were performed for the process change?

Validations performed: Process Validation (PV-GRAN-2025-03, Passed), Potency Validation (PV-POT-2025-02, Passed), Cleaning Validation (CV-GRAN-2025-01, Passed), Equipment Qualification (EQ-MIX-401-REV2, Passed).
What was the potency comparison across batches?

Potency comparison: QF-ER-745 (18 min mixing, 98.6% potency, 1.2% RSD, Reference), QF-ER-750 (12 min mixing, 98.9% potency, 1.1% RSD, Comparable), QF-ER-756 (12 min mixing, 99.1% potency, 1.0% RSD, Comparable).
Who approved the process change tracking document?

Approved by: Dr. Meera Joshi (Head of QA, Aug 14, 2025), R. Singh (Head of Manufacturing, Aug 14, 2025), and L. Chen (Regulatory Affairs Lead, Aug 15, 2025). QA reviewer signature: Dr. Meera Joshi, August 18, 2025.
What packaging records exist for batch VOY756?

Packaging Record (PR-VOY756-01, April 18, 2025) shows packaging materials: Blister Foil (PK-BF-001, LOT-BF-2025, 12,000 pcs), PVC Base Film (PK-PVC-002, LOT-PVC-2025, 12,000 pcs), Cartons (PK-CT-003, LOT-CT-2025, 1,200 pcs), Shippers (PK-SH-004, LOT-SH-2025, 120 pcs), Labels (PK-LB-005, LOT-LB-2025, 1,200 pcs). All stored at Ambient conditions.
What packaging execution activities were performed?

Packaging execution: April 17 Shift A - Arjun Patel completed blistering; April 17 Shift B - Sneha Rao completed cartoning and labeling; April 18 Shift A - Ravi Narayan completed final packing into shippers.
What are the packaging component details?

Packaging components: Bottle (PN-APR-002-BTL, HDPE 100 cc, 810 used, 5 rejected - damaged during filling per DR-APR-003), Label (PN-APR-002-LBL, adhesive, 810 used, 0 rejected - applied to all released units), Cap (PN-APR-002-CAP, tamper-evident, 810 used, 2 rejected - misaligned during sealing).
What is the final container summary for batch VOY756?

Final container summary: Bottles (1 bottle/unit, 810 total containers, Primary container), Carton (30 bottles/carton, 27 total containers, Secondary packaging), Shipper Box (3 cartons/shipper, 9 total containers, For distribution).
What manufacturing process steps were followed for batch VOY756?

Manufacturing process steps: Step 1 - API Addition (06:30-07:00, Operator ML, No deviations), Step 2 - Homogenization (07:00-13:30, Operator RD, No deviations), Step 3 - pH Adjustment (13:30-14:00, Operator ML, No deviations), Step 4 - Final Filtration (14:30-15:45, Operator ST, No deviations), Step 5 - Filling (15:45-21:00, Operator ST, No deviations).
What were the yield results at each manufacturing stage?

Yield results: Formulation stage (Input: 600 L, Output: 600 L, Yield: 100%, Within limits: Yes), Filling stage (Input: 600 L, Output: 600 L, Yield: 99%, Within limits: Yes), Packaging stage (Input: 126,000 mL, Output: 600 Vials, Yield: 100%, Within limits: Yes).
What packaging materials were used for batch VOY756?

Packaging materials: Vials Type I (Supplier: PharmGlass, Lot PG-290058, Qty: 820, Inspected: Yes, Pass), Rubber Stoppers (Supplier: SealSure, Lot SSL-4733, Qty: 820, Inspected: Yes, Pass), Flip-Off Seals (Supplier: CapPro, Lot APC-18770, Qty: 820, Inspected: Yes, Pass).
What was the final disposition of the batch?

Final disposition table shows: Total Released Weight - Part PN-APR-002-CAP (48.6 kg, 97.6% of total batch, Released for packaging and distribution), Total Rejected Weight - Part NA (1.2 kg, 2.4% of total batch, Rejected due to visual defects per Deviation Report DR-APR-002).
Who reviewed and approved the final batch record?
Reviewed by QA: Raj Patel. Manager (QA): Nick JOHANSON. Disposition: Approved. Remarks: Batch meets all release criteria.
What were the manufacturing reviewer details?

Manufacturing reviewer name: NP RP, Review date: 2025-04-24. QA Review Initials on page 1: NP RP2025-04-24. Comments: Material checked and verified against CoA; all specifications within limit. Operator confirmed weight and quantity; deviations were recorded and reviewed. Temperature and humidity conditions monitored throughout the process.
Were all daily reviews completed for batch VOY756?

Yes, according to brrSectionCMO: Daily reviews completed (true), Listed changes (true), All pages accounted (true), All readings entered (true), Calculations accurate (true), Test results entered (true), Optional marked NA (true), Crossouts initialed (true), Temperature trends checked (true), Materials present and labeled (true).
Were materials released and lot numbers correct for batch VOY756?
Yes, according to brrSectionQA inputs: Materials released (true), Correct lot numbers (true), Used before expiry (true).
Were analytical test records complete for batch VOY756?

Yes, according to brrSectionQA analytical section: Test records complete (true), Lab event investigation (true), Conformance (true), COA created (true). Specification number and PR number fields are empty.
Was documentation complete for batch VOY756?

Yes, according to brrSectionQA documentation: Temperature trends (true), Quality reviewer comments (true), Required pages (true), Process changes (true), Process change index (true), Deviation reports (true). Changes and investigations field is empty.
What are the QA signatures for batch VOY756?
QA signatures section shows: QA Reviewer name is empty with no date, QA Manager: Priya Desai with no date specified, Box Number: 23.
What is the Seed and Bulk information for batch VOY756?
Bulk: N/A (not a biologics batch), Seed: N/A. This indicates batch VOY756 is not a biologics batch.
What lot numbers are on part number 85 for batch VOY756?
Part number 85 has lot number VOY756 with dispositioned weight 600 L and 820 Bts containers.
What lot numbers are on part number 75 for batch VOY756?
Part number 75 has lot number VOY756 with dispositioned weight 600 L and 820 Bts containers.
What lot numbers are on part number 92 for batch VOY756?
Part number 92 has lot number VOY756 with dispositioned weight 600 L and 820 Bts containers.
How many pages are in the Batch Record Summary document?

The Batch Record Summary (BRS_VOY756.pdf) contains 6 pages, with detailed information on each page including batch information, yield data, equipment cleaning, in-process controls, environmental monitoring, manufacturing steps, packaging materials, yield summary, and final disposition.
What is the confidence score for BRS_VOY756.pdf classification?
The matched confidence score for BRS_VOY756.pdf is 0.64. It's a scanned document classified as Batch Record Summary.
What percentage of BRS_VOY756.pdf is handwritten vs typed?

Overall, BRS_VOY756.pdf is 7.28% handwritten and 92.72% typed. Page-level breakdown: Page 1 (10.37% handwritten), Page 2 (14.46% handwritten), Pages 3-5 (0.0% handwritten), Page 6 (18.84% handwritten).
What confidence score does ATR_VOY756.pdf have?
ATR_VOY756.pdf has a matched confidence score of 1.0, indicating perfect classification confidence as Analytical Testing Reports / Lab Data Sheets. It's a normal (not scanned) document.
What percentage of COA_VOY756.pdf is handwritten?
COA_VOY756.pdf is 13.33% handwritten and 86.67% typed overall. Page breakdown: Page 1 (12.0% handwritten), Page 2 (14.47% handwritten), Page 3 (10.85% handwritten), Page 4 (16.0% handwritten).
Which document has the lowest handwriting percentage?
CVR_VOY756.pdf, CS_VOY756.pdf, ECR_VOY756.pdf, and CLR.pdf (page 2) all have 0.0% handwriting, being 100% typed documents.
What matched terms are in the Change Control document?

CCI_VOY756.pdf matched terms include: Change Control, Change overview, Impact Assessment, Validation Summary, Training & Implementation Log, Change Approval Log, Approval Summary, Description of Change, CAPA, Type of Change. Confidence score: 0.91.
What is the impact assessment for the manufacturing process change?

Impact assessment shows: Manufacturing Process (Low risk, SOP updated, mixing speed adjusted), Equipment (None risk, RPM validated and logged), Product Quality (None risk, QA verified against specifications), Documentation (Low risk, Version control applied), Regulatory Filing (None risk, Memo added to Annual Product Review).
What validation was performed for the process change?
Validation type: Prospective. Protocol ID: VAL-VOY756-MIXSEQ. Execution Date: April 10–12, 2025.
What are the part numbers documented in batch VOY756?

Part numbers include: PN-APR-002-CAP (found in Batch Record Summary page 6), PN-APR-002-BTL (Packaging Records page 2), PN-APR-002-LBL (Packaging Records page 2), and NA (Batch Record Summary page 6).
What container counts are documented for batch VOY756?
Container counts: 820 Bts (from Batch Record Summary page 1), and specific counts of 810, 27, and 9 (from Packaging Records page 2).
Who are the QA approvers for batch VOY756?
QA Approver: Approver Role - Quality Assurance, Approver Initials: VP. Name and signature fields are empty.
What comments were made by quality reviewers?

Quality reviewer comments include: 'Material checked and verified against CoA; all specifications within limit. Operator Confirmed weight and quantity; deviation were recorded and reviewed. Temperature and humidity conditions monitored throughout the process.' (Page 1), 'Training Records for operators. Confirmed. up to date. QA review UP08/17/2025 reviewed comments. added for 3 minor. observations.' (Page 3), 'VP 08/17/2025 Operator robat rotated according to Corrective actions implemented' (Page 4).
What Bill of Material information is available for batch VOY756?

The Batch Record Summary page 2 contains a Yield Summary Table showing all components with suppliers, lot numbers, quantities used, COA verification, and visual checks. All components (Ceftazorin API, Sterile Water, Benzyl Alcohol, Polysorbate 80, Sodium Citrate) were verified and visually checked.
What is the theoretical yield for batch VOY756?
The theoretical yield is 50,000,000 mg = 50 kg (based on 100,000 tablets at 500 mg average tablet weight).
What is the expected yield range in kg for batch VOY756?
The expected yield range is 48.5 - 51 kg, based on the expected yield percentage range of 95.0% - 102.0%.
What was the average tablet weight for batch VOY756?
The average tablet weight was 500 mg per tablet.
Was the actual yield accepted for batch VOY756?
Yes, the disposition was 'Accepted; within expected range' as the actual yield of 48.925 kg (97.85%) falls within the expected range of 48.5-51 kg (95.0%-102.0%).
When was the equipment cleaning performed and verified?
Equipment cleaning was performed on 2025-04-14. All equipment (MIX-401, FILL-402, TANK-460) had cleaning verified as Yes and passed inspection.
What were the in-process control target ranges?
In-process control target ranges: pH (6.5-7.5 using pH meter), Viscosity (150-200 using Viscometer), Volume Fill (0.1490-0.500 using Gravimetric method).
What environmental monitoring methods were used?

Environmental monitoring methods: Air (Viable) using Settle Plate method (Result: 98%, Limit: 95-100%, Pass), Surface using Contact Plate method (Result: Clean, Limit: Clean, Pass), Personnel using Finger Dab method (Result: None, Limit: None, Pass).
What was the cleanroom grade for batch VOY756?
The cleanroom grade was ISO 7, verified as per SOP. Specific mention of 'ISO 7 Fill Room' appears in multiple documents.
What were the calibration environmental conditions?
Calibration environmental conditions during equipment calibration: Temperature: 22.1°C (Specification: 20–25°C), Humidity: 45% RH (Specification: 40–60% RH), Cleanroom Grade: ISO 7 (As per SOP).
What temperature probe was calibrated and what were the results?

Digital Temperature Probe (Model TPX-3000, Serial SN-TPX-0093-APR, EQ-TEMP-0093) was calibrated. Test results: 20.0°C (Measured: 20.02°C, ±0.1°C tolerance, Pass), 25.0°C (Measured: 25.03°C, Pass), 30.0°C (Measured: 30.05°C, Pass). Performed by Ravi Menon, reviewed by Priya Desai (PD).
What cleaning tasks are defined for daily operations?

Daily cleaning tasks include: Mop floors in Rooms & Corridors (0.5% NaCl, manual mop, gloves & mask PPE), Wipe walls and doors (IPA 70%, wipe down, gloves PPE), Clean weighing balances (IPA 70%, wipe + dry, gloves PPE), Sanitize tools/scoops/paddles (IPA 70%, soak + air dry, gloves & apron PPE), Disinfect transfer containers (IPA 70%, wipe + cover, gloves PPE).
What specific cleaning logs were recorded?

Cleaning logs (CLRT-DC-2025-0818, August 18, 2025) show: Dispensing Room (07:15 AM, NaOCl 0.5%, Mop+wipe, R. Martinez, verified by A. Kapoor), Weighing Balance (07:20 AM, IPA 70%, Wipe+dry, R. Martinez/A. Kapoor), SS Scoops (07:25 AM, IPA 70%, Soak+dry, R. Martinez/A. Kapoor), Transfer Containers (08:15 AM, IPA 70%, Wipe+cover, S. Patel/A. Kapoor), Granulation Room (08:00 AM, NaOCl 0.5%, Mop+wipe, S. Patel/A. Kapoor), Mixing Paddles (08:10 AM, IPA 70%, Wipe+dry, S. Patel/A. Kapoor), Corridor Zone A (08:30 AM, NaOCl 0.5%, Mop+wipe, J. Lin/A. Kapoor).
What storage conditions were specified for raw materials?
Storage conditions specified: Aryl Piperazine HCl (20–25°C, dry area), Sodium Acetate Anhydrous (Ambient), Dibasic Sodium Phosphate (Ambient).
What grades of materials were used in batch VOY756?
Material grades used: Aryl Piperazine HCl (USP grade), Sodium Acetate Anhydrous (LR grade), Dibasic Sodium Phosphate (AR grade).
What vendors supplied the raw materials?

Vendors: Solvax Chemicals Pvt Ltd (Aryl Piperazine HCl), ChemPure Organics (Sodium Acetate Anhydrous), BioBase Inc. (Dibasic Sodium Phosphate and Sodium Citrate), ActiveChem Ltd. (Ceftazorin API), AquaMed Pharma (Sterile Water), Purity Chemicals (Benzyl Alcohol), EmulTech (Polysorbate 80).

What was the sample ID and sampling date for COA testing?
Sample ID: SAMP-002, Sampling Date: 2025-04-16, used for Certificate of Analysis testing documented in COA_VOY756.pdf.
What Test Summary categories were evaluated in the analytical testing?

Test Summary categories: Identity (Confirmed via NMR and FTIR spectral match), Purity (HPLC 99.1%, exceeding minimum), Potency (Within ±2% of label claim), Safety (No residual solvents or microbial contamination), Stability (No degradation under cold chain), Visual Inspection (No particulates, discoloration, or phase separation), Data Integrity (All raw data archived in LIMS; audit trail verified).
Were there any temperature excursions during manufacturing?

Yes, one temperature excursion occurred on 2025-04-18 at 08:00 in the Fill Room. Temperature reached 25.8°C for 10 minutes duration. Cause: HVAC fluctuation. Impact: Minor. CAPA-003 was implemented with HVAC recalibration.
What was the monitoring period for environmental monitoring?
The environmental monitoring period was April 15–April 24, 2025, as documented in EMR-SYN-4737.
What environmental monitoring parameters were tracked?
Parameters tracked: Temperature (Pass), Humidity (Pass), Particle Count (Pass), Surface Cleanliness (Pass), Personnel Hygiene (Pass). All parameters passed requirements.
What investigation findings were documented?

Investigation findings from root cause analysis: HVAC Logs showed temporary sensor lag detected, Operator Activity showed no deviation from SOP, Equipment Heat Load was normal, Historical Data showed no prior excursions in the fill room.
What corrective actions have completion status?

Corrective actions status from IR-VOY756-07: Update SOP-MFG-104 (Completed by Priya Desai, April 20, 2025), Retrain operators on revised SOP (Completed by Vishal Mehta, April 21, 2025), Implement version control audit (Completed by Ravi Narayan, April 22, 2025), Add mixing order prompt to HMI (In Progress by Kunal D'Souza, April 25, 2025).
How many deviation reports were filed and what types?

Five deviation reports were filed: DEV-003 (Process type, Minor), DEV-004 (Documentation type, Minor), DEV-005 (Equipment type, Moderate), DEV-006 (Environmental type, Moderate), DEV-007 (Material Handling type, Major).
What was the corrective action for DEV-004?

For DEV-004 (Missing initials on volume fill log, 2025-04-16): Cause was operator oversight. Corrective action: Log updated and verified. Preventive action: Refresher training on documentation SOP. CAPA-004 was assigned and closed on 2025-04-20.
What was the corrective action for DEV-006?

For DEV-006 (ISO 7 room particle count exceeded, 2025-04-19): Cause was improper gowning technique. Corrective action: Area re-cleaned and retested. Preventive action: Gowning retraining for staff. Responsible: Dr. Emilia Novak. CAPA-006 closed on 2025-04-22.
What was the corrective action for DEV-007?

For DEV-007 (Incorrect label on raw material container, 2025-04-20): Cause was warehouse labeling error. Corrective action: Container relabeled and reconciled. Preventive action: Barcode verification added to receipt SOP. Responsible: Mr. Jean-Pierre Moreau. CAPA-007 closed on 2025-04-23.
What is the verification method for cleaning verification?
The verification method used was: Swab Test + Visual Inspection + Conductivity Check, as documented in CVR-VOY756-01 performed on April 14, 2025.
What conductivity results were obtained for equipment cleaning?
Conductivity results for all equipment (MIX-401, FILL-402, TANK-460, PUMP-210) showed <1 µS/cm, meeting acceptable limits. FILTER-115 had N/A for conductivity as it's a sterile filter.
What cleaning summary checklist items were completed?

Cleaning summary checklist: Cleaning agents verified (Yes), SOP followed for each equipment (Yes), Cleaning logs completed (Yes), Inspection passed (Yes), QA review completed (Yes), Equipment released for use (Yes). Final QA Signature: Harvey Rosenblum, 2025-04-15.
What cleaning methods were used for each equipment?

All major equipment (MIX-401, FILL-402, TANK-460, PUMP-210) used standardized cleaning procedures with operator initials recorded. FILTER-115 maintained sterile status. Cleaning dates: 2025-04-14, with QA review dates: 2025-04-15. All statuses: Approved.
What location is equipment MIX-401 used in?
Equipment MIX-401 (Mixing Vessel) is located in Line 4 – Prep Room. Last used on 2025-04-13, cleaned on 2025-04-14, inspection showed no residue with conductivity <1 µS/cm.
What location is equipment FILL-402 used in?
Equipment FILL-402 (Filling Machine) is located in Line 4 – Fill Room. Last used on 2025-04-13, cleaned on 2025-04-14, inspection showed clean status with conductivity <1 µS/cm.
What was the incident described in the Investigation Report?

The incident (IR-VOY756-07, April 18, 2025) occurred on April 16, 2025 at Line 4 – Injectable Fill Line. During compounding, unexpected foam volume increase was observed after adding Aryl Piperazine HCl. Foam overflowed the mixing vessel, resulting in ~0.3 kg material loss and 45-minute delay. No contamination occurred. Initial Classification: Minor Deviation (DR-VOY756-03).

RM-PHOS-003 is Dibasic Sodium Phosphate, AR grade, supplied by BioBase Inc., Lot LOT-APR-005, stored at Ambient conditions.

Container IDs: CNT-04578 (RM-APQ-001, 25 kg, Released), CNT-04579 (RM-SOL-008, 15 kg, Released), CNT-04580 (RM-PHOS-003, 20 kg, Quarantined).

What process change was tracked in PCTD_VOY756.pdf?

Process Change Tracking Document PCTD-2025-0818-PC01 tracks changes for product Quetiapine Fumarate Extended Release Tablets, batch QF-ER-756, initiated August 10, 2025. Focus on blend uniformity and potency distribution impacts.
What risk levels were identified in the impact assessment?

Impact assessment risk levels: Blend Uniformity (Low risk - Additional sampling and stratified testing), Potency Distribution (Medium risk - Comparative potency validation), Batch Yield (Positive - 6% increase observed), Equipment Utilization (Positive - Reduced downtime), Regulatory Filing (Low risk - Documented in Annual Product Review).
What validation protocols were executed for the process change?

Validation protocols executed: PV-GRAN-2025-03 (Process Validation, Passed), PV-POT-2025-02 (Potency Validation, Passed), CV-GRAN-2025-01 (Cleaning Validation, Passed), EQ-MIX-401-REV2 (Equipment Qualification, Passed).
What potency comparison was performed across batches?

Potency comparison shows improvement: QF-ER-745 (18 min mixing, 98.6% potency, 1.2% RSD, Reference batch), QF-ER-750 (12 min mixing, 98.9% potency, 1.1% RSD, Comparable), QF-ER-756 (12 min mixing, 99.1% potency, 1.0% RSD, Comparable). Mixing time reduced by 6 minutes with improved potency and consistency.
Who were the change approval log approvers for PCTD?

Change approval log approvers: Dr. Meera Joshi (Head of QA, Aug 14, 2025), R. Singh (Head of Manufacturing, Aug 14, 2025), L. Chen (Regulatory Affairs Lead, Aug 15, 2025). Final QA reviewer signature: Dr. Meera Joshi, August 18, 2025.

What operators worked on batch VOY756 manufacturing steps?

Operators: ML worked on API Addition (06:30-07:00) and pH Adjustment (13:30-14:00), RD worked on Homogenization (07:00-13:30), ST worked on Final Filtration (14:30-15:45) and Filling (15:45-21:00). No deviations reported for any step.
What was the homogenization time for batch VOY756?
Homogenization (Step 2) took 6.5 hours, from 07:00 to 13:30, performed by operator RD with no deviations.
How long did the filling process take?
The filling process (Step 5) took 5 hours and 15 minutes, from 15:45 to 21:00, performed by operator ST with no deviations.

Were there any process changes documented?

Yes, process changes were documented (processChanges: true, processChangeIndex: true). The main process change involved revising the mixing sequence to introduce Sodium Acetate first, followed by gradual Aryl Piperazine addition under controlled RPM to minimize foaming.
